result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Marie Thorp

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Defendant Melissa Marie Thorp in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Melissa Marie Thorp.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Attorney DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court sets preliminary hearing.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.

THORP, MELISSA  CASE: H22092501

Possession of Meth with intent to Deliver

2:33 PM DE Melissa Thorp in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt (special appearance).  Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement regarding bond.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for October 18, 2022  at 8:30AM.
